00003 /*! \file response_manager.h
00004     \brief Host Driver:  Response queues for host instructions.
00005 */
00006 
00007 #ifndef __RESPONSE_MANAGER_H__
00008 #define __RESPONSE_MANAGER_H__
00009  
00010 #include "octeon_instr.h"
00011 #include "octeon_iq.h"
00012 #include "pending_list.h"
00013 
00014 
00015 
00016 /* Maximum ordered requests to process in every invocation of
00017    process_ordered_list(). The function will continue to process requests as
00018    long as it can find one that has finished processing. If it keeps finding
00019    requests that have completed, the function can run for ever. The value
00020    defined here sets an upper limit on the number of requests it can process
00021    before it returns control to the poll thread.
00022 */
00023 #define  MAX_ORD_REQS_TO_PROCESS   4096
00024 
00025 
00026 
00027 
00028 
00029 /** Head of a response list. There are 6 response lists in the
00030  *  system. One for each response order- Unordered, ordered
00031  *  and 1 for noresponse entries on each instruction queue.
00032  */
00033 typedef struct {
00034 
00035   /** List structure to add delete pending entries to */
00036    cavium_list_t head;
00037 
00038   /** A lock for this response list */
00039    cavium_spinlock_t lock;
00040 
00041 } octeon_response_list_t;
00042 
00043 
00044 
00045 
00046 
00047 
00048 
00049 /** The type of response list.
00050  */
00051 typedef enum {
00052      OCTEON_ORDERED_LIST=0,
00053      OCTEON_UNORDERED_NONBLOCKING_LIST=1,
00054      OCTEON_UNORDERED_BLOCKING_LIST=2
00055 }OCTEON_RESPONSE_LIST;
00056 
00057 
00058 
00059 
00060 /** Gets the response list index given the response order
00061  *  and instruction queue number.
00062  */
00063 #define GET_RESPONSE_LIST(resp_order, resp_mode, resp_list)  \
00064            if(resp_order == OCTEON_RESP_ORDERED)                   \
00065                resp_list = OCTEON_ORDERED_LIST;                    \
00066            else                                                    \
00067                if(resp_mode == OCTEON_RESP_BLOCKING)               \
00068                    resp_list = OCTEON_UNORDERED_BLOCKING_LIST;     \
00069                else                                                \
00070                    resp_list = OCTEON_UNORDERED_NONBLOCKING_LIST;
00071 
00072 
00073 
00074 
00075 
00076 
00077 /** Initialize the response lists. The number of response lists to create is
00078   * given by count.
00079   * @param octeon_dev      - the octeon device structure.
00080   */
00081 int   octeon_setup_response_list(octeon_device_t *octeon_dev);
00082 
00083 
00084 
00085 void  octeon_delete_response_list(octeon_device_t *octeon_dev);
00086 
00087 
00088 /** Adds a instruction waitinng for a response from octeon to a response list.
00089   * @param resp_list - the response list to which the entry is added.
00090   * @param entry     - the pending entry that tracks the instruction.
00091   */
00092 void  push_response_list(octeon_response_list_t *resp_list,
00093                          octeon_pending_entry_t *entry);
00094 
00095 
00096 /** Checks the noresponse list associated with one of four instr queues.
00097   * The new read index tells the driver that last entry in the instr queue
00098   * where octeon has read an instr. The routine cleans up all entries from 
00099   * the previously marked (old) read index to the current (new) read index.
00100   * @param octeon_dev      - the octeon device structure.
00101   * @param resp_list       - one of four noresponse lists.
00102   * @param old_read_index  - octeon read till this index previously.
00103   * @param new_read_index  - octeon has read till this index now.
00104   * @param instr_queue     - the instruction queue associated with "resp_list"
00105   */
00106 void
00107 process_noresponse_list(octeon_device_t       *oct,
00108                         octeon_instr_queue_t  *iq);
00109 
00110 
00111 /** Check the unordered response queue for the entry in "query".
00112   * Checks if an entry exists and if it does returns the current status
00113   * of that entry. If the instruction at that entry finished processing or
00114   * has timed-out, the entry is cleaned.
00115   * @param octeon_dev   -  the octeon device structure.
00116   * @param query        -  the query holds the request id of the entry to check
00117   * @return 0 if the entry existed, its status is returned in query->status.
00118   *         1 otherwise.
00119   */
00120 int process_unordered_poll(octeon_device_t         *octeon_dev,
00121                            octeon_query_request_t  *query);
00122 
00123 
00124 /** Check the status of first entry in the ordered list. If the instruction at
00125   * that entry finished processing or has timed-out, the entry is cleaned.
00126   * @param octeon_dev  - the octeon device structure.
00127   * @return 1 if the ordered list is empty, 0 otherwise.  
00128   */
00129 int process_ordered_list(octeon_device_t *octeon_dev);
00130 
00131 
00132 /** Routine executed as a tasklet for request completion processing in
00133   * interrupt context. It gets scheduled by the interrupt handler whenever
00134   * a FORCEINT interrupt is received on DMA Counter 1. It checks upto 16
00135   * UNORDERED BLOCKING mode requests for completion and calls their callback
00136   * function if the request is completed (or has timedout).
00137   */
00138 void
00139 octeon_request_completion_bh(unsigned long pdev);
00140 
00141 
00142 
00143 
00144 /**  Delete all allocation made for a soft instruction. The alloc flags for the
00145   *  instruction are checked to determine what buffers are to be deleted.
00146   *  @param  octeon_dev  -  the octeon device structure.
00147   *  @param  soft_instr  -  the soft instruction to deallocate.
00148   */
00149 void  delete_soft_instr(octeon_device_t            *octeon_dev,
00150                         octeon_soft_instruction_t  *soft_instr);
00151 
00152 
00153 /**  Free the pending instruction from the pending list and from response list.
00154   *  @param  octeon_dev    -  the octeon device structure.
00155   *  @param pending_entry  -  the entry to be freed.
00156   *  @param iq_no          -  the instr queue on which the instruction
00157   *                           was posted.
00158   */
00159 void  free_instr_from_lists(octeon_device_t            *octeon_dev,
00160                             octeon_pending_entry_t     *pending_entry,
00161                             uint32_t                      iq_no);

00165 #endif
